result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody R. Woodard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jerod Barkley in court.   Defendant does not appear in court.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion Hearing for sentence credit to be heard today.

9:36 a.m.   Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Atty Barkley filed a motion hearing for sentence credit for his client.
Atty Barkley states the number of sentence credit for days from February 3 - October 8, 2014, for a total number of 227 days.
Atty Knaapen makes statements that the defendant had been in custody on another matter during this time and is not entitled to the credit for days sat on this case.
Atty Barkley makes statements regarding the credit for his client.  Atty Barkley states he was unable to obtain a stipulation from the State regarding the sentence credit.
Atty Knaapen states that the defendant's first appearance on this case was not until April 2014.
Court makes statements regarding the status of this case and the records do not indicate that the defendant had been in jail on this case.
Court questions if the defendant is serving any jail time currently.  Atty Barkley makes his statements.
Atty Knaapen makes statements that the defendant would be entitled to 2 days of jail credit on this case.
9:43 a.m.  Court is reviewing file.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants 2 days credit and would allow the defendant to argue in the future if he is revoked.
Associated with Charge #1

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cody R. Woodard in court with attorney Jerod Albert Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

2:09 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

There is a plea agreement. 
Defendant will plead to Count 1. Count 2 would be dismissed and read in. Parties would be willing to proceed without a PSI. 
withheld sentence, 24 mo prob, obt/mtn ft empt, other counseling, dna sample unless provided, court costs, dna surcharge of $250.

Atty Barkley concurs with the agreement.
Atty Barkley states that the Defendant has paid the DNA surcharge on another case.
Court addresses the surcharge.
Defendant concurs with agreement.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Barkley for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.
Court takes a moment to review the complaint.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Attempt to Flee/Elude a Traffic Officer
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Barkley wishes to continue without a PSI for reasons stated on the record.
2:19 PM Atty Barkley takes a moment with his client regarding a PSI.
Defendant feels that he does not need to have the report prepared at this point.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing, Defendant has a terrible criminal record. 
Atty Barkley addresses the Court prior to sentencing. Defendant is on extended supervision for approximately 5 years. Requests for transfer of probation to Lincoln County. Defendant begins work at APS in Wausau, as a welder. Defendant did post a cash bond of $1,000, requests to be applied to any court costs.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. Court believes plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1: 
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Concurrent with the supervision or any probation that Defendant is currently on
Conditions:
Obtain and maintain full time employment
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Pay fine of $300 plus costs
Pay DNA surcharge of $250
Drivers License Revoked 6 months
Bond to be applied to fines/costs/surcharges

Atty Barkley will submit a separate stipulation with regards to jail credit.

Plea/Sentencing 10/21
Released from prison
re: Motion for Bond Reduction
